cards.name: Aegis Angel
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

rulings.text: If Aegis Angel leaves the battlefield, you no longer control it.
If Aegis Angel and the permanent would be destroyed simultaneously, only Aegis Angel will be destroyed.
If another player gains control of Aegis Angel, the permanent will no longer have indestructible, even if you regain control of Aegis Angel.

cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.flavor:
"It saddens me to lose a source of inspiration. This one seemed especially promising."
—Ashiok
cards.name: Mind Rot

cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.
cards.name: Nightmare
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.
cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.flavor:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Walking Corpse

cards.flavor: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.
cards.name: Borderland Marauder
cards.originalText: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.text: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cone of Flame
cards.originalText: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

rulings.text: Each of the three targets must be different. If there aren't three different legal targets available, you can't cast the spell.
If one or two of Cone of Flame's targets are illegal when it resolves, you can't change how much damage will be dealt to the remaining legal targets.

cards.text: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Tie a mouse under a bridge, and your cabbages will triple in size."
—Kithkin superstition
cards.name: Incremental Growth
cards.originalText: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, two +1/+1 counters on another target creature, and three +1/+1 counters on a third target creature.

rulings.text: You must choose three different targets in order to cast Incremental Growth. You decide how many +1/+1 counters each creature will get as part of casting the spell.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Incremental Growth tries to resolve, the remaining legal targets still get the appropriate number of +1/+1 counters. If all targets are illegal, Incremental Growth is countered.

cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, two +1/+1 counters on another target creature, and three +1/+1 counters on a third target creature.

cards.flavor:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
cards.name: Oakenform
Soul of the Harvest
cards.originalText:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: A creature card that enters the battlefield as a copy of a token creature is still a nontoken creature. You'll be able to draw a card.

cards.text:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
